docs.snippet: The latest sign of growing unease over the valuations of some richly priced companies has emerged with Snapchat being discounted 25 percent by Fidelity, the mutual fund giant....
docs.lead_paragraph: The latest sign of growing unease over the valuations of some richly priced companies has emerged with Snapchat being discounted 25 percent by Fidelity, the mutual fund giant.
docs.abstract: Mutual funds have discounted worth of several hot ticket technology start-ups, offering sign of growing unease over soaring valuations; Fidelity's 25 percent devaluation of Snapchat and Black Rock's devaluation of Dropbox highlight how mutual funds that inflate prices of companies in first place can affect them negatively later on.

headline.main: Dizzying Ride May Be Ending for Tech Start-Ups
